trans-unit.source: Provides a type converter to convert <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.BuiltInRole"></xref> enumeration values to <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole"></xref> enumeration values.
This type converter supports the Visual Basic <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.User> object.
For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
> [!CAUTION] > You should never create an instance of a BuiltInRoleConverter class.
Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class.
For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.BuiltInRoleConverter"></xref> class.
This type converter supports the Visual Basic <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.User> object.
Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object to the given destination type using the context.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from.
This can be `Nothing`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `Nothing`.
This type converter supports the Visual Basic <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.User> object.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> object that provides a format context.
A <xref:System.Type> object that represents the type you wish to convert to.
A <xref:System.Boolean> object that indicates whether this converter can perform the conversion.
Converts the given object to another type.
The most common types to convert to and convert from are string objects.
The default implementation makes a call to <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> on the object if the object is valid and if the destination type is <xref:System.String>.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from.
This can be `Nothing`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `Nothing`.
This type converter supports the Visual Basic <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.User> object.
A formatter context.
The culture into which `value` will be converted.
The object to convert.
The type to convert the object to.
The converted object.
destinationType is .
The conversion cannot be performed.
